translated: the Tathagata, whose body is wisdom.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'di thob nas 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'di thob nas 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, having attained this through the method of dependent origination by worldly convention, this arises.

original: yung ba dang rdo thal gyi sbyor ba las dmar ba nyid bzhin du las thams cad bsgrub pa la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yung ba dang rdo thal gyi sbyor ba las dmar ba nyid bzhin du las thams cad bsgrub pa la rig par bya'o //
translated: Like the redness that arises from the combination of indigo and chalk, it should be known that all actions are accomplished.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas so zhes pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa las sgrub pa'i nges pa'o zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel pa drug stong par sngags kyi rigs kyi le'u las rab 'byam sgrub pa'i yongs su bcad pa ste drug pa'o
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas so zhes pa'i nga rgyal gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa las sgrub pa'i nges pa'o zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel pa drug stong par sngags kyi rigs kyi le'u las rab 'byam sgrub pa'i yongs su bcad pa ste drug pa'o
translated: This is the definition of the practice from the chapter on the mantra types in the six thousand verse Hevajra Tantra.

original: / // / kye'i rdo rje'i h'um la 'dud nas //
analyzed: / // / kye'i rdo rje'i h'um la 'dud nas //
translated: Homage to the Hum of Hevajra.

original: sna tshogs sgrub pa bshad par bya //
analyzed: sna tshogs sgrub pa bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the various practices.

original: sems can rnams la rjes brtse bas //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rjes brtse bas //
translated: Out of compassion for sentient beings,

original: sa la char pa dbab ched du'o //
analyzed: sa la char pa dbab ched du'o //
translated: for the sake of bringing rain to the earth.

original: aa phu:'i yi ge gnyis kyis mtha' yas kyi gzugs brnyan byas la zhes pa 'dir mtha' yas kyi gzugs brnyan /
analyzed: aa phu:'i yi ge gnyis kyis mtha' yas kyi gzugs brnyan byas la zhes pa 'dir mtha' yas kyi gzugs brnyan /
translated: The two letters a and phu are the image of limitless.

original: dri zhim po'i tsandan las byung ba @30b byas te /
analyzed: dri zhim po'i tsandan las byung ba @30b byas te /
translated: Here, the image of limitless is made from fragrant sandalwood.

original: lte ba yan chad skyes bu'i cha byad can 'og sbrul gyi mjug ma'i rnam pa can lag pa bzhi pa g-yon du bdud rtsi'i thod pa dang / pad+ma'i lag pa can /
analyzed: lte ba yan chad skyes bu'i cha byad can 'og sbrul gyi mjug ma'i rnam pa can lag pa bzhi pa g-yon du bdud rtsi'i thod pa dang / pad+ma'i lag pa can /
translated: Up to the navel it has the form of a man, below it is in the form of a snake's tail, it has four arms, and in the left it has a skull cup of nectar and a lotus.

original: g-yas par bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang rin po che'i lag pa can /
analyzed: g-yas par bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang rin po che'i lag pa can /
translated: On the right, the nāga king Padma, with a hand holding a fruit of nectar and a jewel.

original: mgo bo'i steng du gdengs ka bdun pa can khor yug gi rnam pa can bya ste /
analyzed: mgo bo'i steng du gdengs ka bdun pa can khor yug gi rnam pa can bya ste /
translated: Above the head, the nāga king Sāṇḍaka, with seven hoods in the form of a circle.

original: de dang 'dra bar de'i g-yon du klu'i rgyal po aam yig gis so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar de'i g-yon du klu'i rgyal po aam yig gis so zhes pa'o //
translated: To the left of him, the nāga king Anavatapta, similar to him.

original: de bdud rtsi lngas bkru bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bdud rtsi lngas bkru bar bya ste /
translated: He should be bathed with the five nectars.

original: 'o ma dang / zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / ka ra rnams bdud rtsi lnga ste /
analyzed: 'o ma dang / zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / ka ra rnams bdud rtsi lnga ste /
translated: Milk, curd, honey, ghee, and sugar are the five nectars.

original: des bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: des bkru bar bya'o //
translated: With those, he should be bathed.

original: de nas autpala sngon pos mchod par bya'o //🔽klu 'dul ba'i khu bas lus la byug par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas autpala sngon pos mchod par bya'o // klu 'dul ba'i khu bas lus la byug par bya ste /
translated: Then he should be worshipped with blue lotuses.🔽The body should be anointed with the juice that subdues nāgas.

original: glang po che'i chang gis mgo bo byugs la /
analyzed: glang po che'i chang gis mgo bo byugs la /
translated: The head should be anointed with elephant liquor.

original: kham phor gnyis kha sbyor du byas nas /
analyzed: kham phor gnyis kha sbyor du byas nas /
translated: Two joined bowls

original: ba nag mo'i 'o mas dgang ste /
analyzed: ba nag mo'i 'o mas dgang ste /
translated: should be filled with the milk of a black cow.

original: sor mo bzhis dpral ba dang / sna dang ao sko'i mthar thug pa dang / phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis pa'i tshad can gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sor mo bzhis dpral ba dang / sna dang ao sko'i mthar thug pa dang / phyed dang bcas pa'i sor bcu gnyis pa'i tshad can gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Four fingers should be placed on the forehead, nose, and ending at the eyebrows, twelve finger-breadths in size, together with half.

original: gzhon nu ma nag pos bkal ba rims kyis btsos pa'i skud pas phyogs brgyad rnams su dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma nag pos bkal ba rims kyis btsos pa'i skud pas phyogs brgyad rnams su dkri bar bya'o //
translated: The young woman should be black, and the thread should be spun by a widow.

original: de nas rdzing bu'i 'gram du rlung gi phyogs su dkyil 'khor bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdzing bu'i 'gram du rlung gi phyogs su dkyil 'khor bya ste /
translated: Then, on the bank of a pond, in a place with a wind, one should make a maṇḍala.

original: rdzing bu'i dbus su klu'i rgyal po mtha' yas der gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzing bu'i dbus su klu'i rgyal po mtha' yas der gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of the pond, one should place the king of the nāgas Ananta.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du ni mtha' yas mnan pa'i kye'i rdo rje rdul tshon gyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du ni mtha' yas mnan pa'i kye'i rdo rje rdul tshon gyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the maṇḍala of colored powder, one should draw with colored powder Ananta-ārya-hevajra.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor du tshon gdab pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor du tshon gdab pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should speak about the colors in the maṇḍala:

original: dur khrod kyi sol bas rdul tshon nag po'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol bas rdul tshon nag po'o //
translated: The black color is made from charnel ground ash,

original: mi'i rus pa'i phye mas dkar po dang / ba blas ser po dang / dur khrod kyi so phag gis dmar po dang / rkun ma'i lo ma mi'i rus pa cung zad bsres pas ljang gu ste /
analyzed: mi'i rus pa'i phye mas dkar po dang / ba blas ser po dang / dur khrod kyi so phag gis dmar po dang / rkun ma'i lo ma mi'i rus pa cung zad bsres pas ljang gu ste /
translated: the white from human bone powder, the yellow from cow dung, the red from charnel ground brick, and the green from the leaves of a śamī tree mixed with a little human bone.

original: rdul tshon lnga po 'di rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas dang por dur khrod kyi srad bus zhes pa ro'i rgyus pa rnams kyis byas pa'i srad bus thig btab nas sor gsum lhag pa'i khru gsum pa smin ma'i dbus nas lte ba'i mthar thug pa'i tshad rnams kyis
analyzed: rdul tshon lnga po 'di rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas dang por dur khrod kyi srad bus zhes pa ro'i rgyus pa rnams kyis byas pa'i srad bus thig btab nas sor gsum lhag pa'i khru gsum pa smin ma'i dbus nas lte ba'i mthar thug pa'i tshad rnams kyis
translated: Having constructed the mandala with these five colored powders, first with the thread of the charnel ground means that having laid down the lines with the thread made from the sinews of corpses, [the mandala] is three cubits in size, with the measure from the middle of the eyebrows to the navel, exceeding by three finger-widths.

original: te 'gro ba 'ong ba rnams kyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: te 'gro ba 'ong ba rnams kyi zhes pa'o //
translated: That is, for those who go and come.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyed kyis pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa byas nas cha gsum gyi lte ba cha gcig la nyi ma'i gdan no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyed kyis pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa byas nas cha gsum gyi lte ba cha gcig la nyi ma'i gdan no //
translated: Having made an eight-petaled lotus with half of the mandala, the center is one part, and the sun seat is one part.

original: de'i steng du mtha' yas dang / mtha' yas kyi rgyal po ste /🔽kye'i rdo rje'i g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i zhabs dag gi mthil la rgyal ba @31a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du mtha' yas dang / mtha' yas kyi rgyal po ste / kye'i rdo rje'i g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i zhabs dag gi mthil la rgyal ba @31a * //
translated: Above that, Ananta and Ananta-rāja🔽are drawn on the soles of the left and right feet of Hevajra.

original: dang rnam par rgyal ba bri'o //
analyzed: dang rnam par rgyal ba bri'o //
translated: The Victor and the Victorious are drawn on the soles of the left and right feet of Hevajra.

original: kye'i rdo rje zhal brgyad pa zhabs bzhi pa phyag bcu drug gis brgyan pa bdag med mas phrag pa la 'khril ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i spyan nyi shu rtsa bzhis phyug pa'o //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje zhal brgyad pa zhabs bzhi pa phyag bcu drug gis brgyan pa bdag med mas phrag pa la 'khril ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i spyan nyi shu rtsa bzhis phyug pa'o //
translated: He is Hevajra with eight faces, four feet, and sixteen arms, embraced by Nairatmya, and endowed with twenty-four eyes as will be explained.

original: de nas pad+ma'i 'dab ma rnams la klu'i dbang po brgyad rnams te gdengs ka lnga dang / lhag ma mtha' yas kyi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas pad+ma'i 'dab ma rnams la klu'i dbang po brgyad rnams te gdengs ka lnga dang / lhag ma mtha' yas kyi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then on the lotus petals are the eight lords of the nagas, with five hoods, and the rest like the form of Ananta.

original: 'dab ma g-yon pa la mtha' yas so //
analyzed: 'dab ma g-yon pa la mtha' yas so //
translated: On the left petal is Ananta.

original: g-yas pa la nor rgyas kyi bu'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa la nor rgyas kyi bu'o //
translated: On the right petal is Vasuki.

original: nub tu 'jog po'o //
analyzed: nub tu 'jog po'o //
translated: In the west is Takshaka.

original: shar du ka rko ta'o //🔽me mtshams su pad+ma'o //
analyzed: shar du ka rko ta'o // me mtshams su pad+ma'o //
translated: In the east is Karkota.🔽In the southeast is Padma.

original: rlung phyogs su pad+ma chen po'o //🔽bden bral du dung skyong ngo //
analyzed: rlung phyogs su pad+ma chen po'o // bden bral du dung skyong ngo //
translated: In the northeast is Mahapadma.

original: dbang ldan du rigs ldan no //
analyzed: dbang ldan du rigs ldan no //
translated: In the southwest is Sankhapala.🔽In the northwest is Kulika.

original: sa bon 'di rnams kyi lte dbus su aa phu'o //
analyzed: sa bon 'di rnams kyi lte dbus su aa phu'o //
translated: In the center of these seed syllables is A.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu:'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu:'o //
translated: On the right and left petals and so forth are PHU PHU PHU PHU PHU PHU PHU PHU.

original: phu: yig brgyad po 'di rnams kyis klu brgyad yongs su rdzogs pa bya ste /🔽shar dang mer nag po'o //
analyzed: phu: yig brgyad po 'di rnams kyis klu brgyad yongs su rdzogs pa bya ste / shar dang mer nag po'o //
translated: One should make the eight nāgas complete with these eight syllables.🔽In the east and southeast, black.

original: lho dang bden bral du dmar po'o //
analyzed: lho dang bden bral du dmar po'o //
translated: In the south and southwest, red.

original: nub dang rlung phyogs su ser po'o //
analyzed: nub dang rlung phyogs su ser po'o //
translated: In the west and northwest, yellow.

original: byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po ste /
analyzed: byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po ste /
translated: In the north and northeast, white.

original: thugs dang gsung dang ye shes dang / sku'i zhal gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: thugs dang gsung dang ye shes dang / sku'i zhal gyi dbye bas so //
translated: This is the division of the faces of the mind, speech, gnosis, and body.

original: gnas rkyal du 'gyel ba'i mjug ma mnan par thams cad bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas rkyal du 'gyel ba'i mjug ma mnan par thams cad bri bar bya'o //
translated: All of them should be drawn with the tail pressed down, lying in the place of rest.

original: de bzhin du shar gyi sa gzhi nag po'o //🔽lho dmar po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar gyi sa gzhi nag po'o // lho dmar po'o //
translated: Likewise, the ground in the east is black.🔽In the south, red.

original: nub tu ser po'o //
analyzed: nub tu ser po'o //
translated: In the west, yellow.🔽In the north, white.

original: byang dkar po ste re kh'a lnga'i mthar thug pa'o //🔽dkyil 'khor gyi brgyad cha'i sgo ste de bzhin du 'gram dang sgo khyud rnams so //
analyzed: byang dkar po ste re kh'a lnga'i mthar thug pa'o // dkyil 'khor gyi brgyad cha'i sgo ste de bzhin du 'gram dang sgo khyud rnams so //
translated: This is the end of the five lines.🔽The door is one-eighth of the maṇḍala, and likewise the sides and the door frame.

original: sgo'i phyed kyi stegs bu dang dra ba'i sa gzhi'o //
analyzed: sgo'i phyed kyi stegs bu dang dra ba'i sa gzhi'o //
translated: The platform and the net ground are half of the door.

original: stegs bu'i phyed kyis re kh'a lnga dang rin po che'i snam bu dang / ba ku li dang / kra ma sh'i rsha rnams so //
analyzed: stegs bu'i phyed kyis re kh'a lnga dang rin po che'i snam bu dang / ba ku li dang / kra ma sh'i rsha rnams so //
translated: The platform is half the width of the mandala.

original: sgo'i sum 'gyur rta babs te /🔽mtshams su sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sgo'i sum 'gyur rta babs te / mtshams su sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: The archways are one-third the width of the gate.🔽In the corners there are crossed vajras.

original: phyi rol du rdo rje'i phreng ba 'bar ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du rdo rje'i phreng ba 'bar ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Outside there is a vajra garland with flames.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas de nas sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas de nas sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Having thus constructed the mandala, one should perform the homa.

original: zlum po'i thab tu zhi ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: zlum po'i thab tu zhi ba'i don du'o //
translated: In a round hearth for the sake of pacification.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor rab gnas byas la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor rab gnas byas la /
translated: Then, having consecrated the mandala,

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtor ma byin te /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtor ma byin te /
translated: one should offer the oblation that will be explained.🔽With the mantra:

original: ain da / dza ma /
analyzed: ain da / dza ma /
translated: eṇḍajaṃ, jamaḥ,

original: dza la / dza kkha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis so //
analyzed: dza la / dza kkha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis so //

analyzed: phyi nas slob dpon gyis nang gi khro bo'i sems kyis sngags bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: nang gi zhes pa cung zad spro ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis so zhes pa'o //

analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor du sgo srung @31b rnams gzhag la bum pa bcu dgod cing steng du 'o mas gang ba'i kham phor rnams bzhag nas phyi rol du /

analyzed: phyogs bcu rnams su ba dan sngon bo rnams byin te dben pa'i gnas su sngags 'di bzla bar bya'o //

analyzed: h'a sv'a ta phat phat pha h'um h'um h'um phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu: phu:/
translated: Hasvața phaṭ phaṭ pha ha ha ha huḥ puḥ puḥ puḥ puḥ puḥ puḥ puḥ puḥ.

translated: Yajña-gata-yajña-gata-yaśa-gata-yaśa-ka ānāgātām gala-tā-pāptam sakam ru ru he he ye ta-padhīgānāya rakṣa-vakṣa-ntana-ayata-ghāya-ghāya-ghāta

translated: ghasa-masam.

translated: Tu ghu ghu gha-ghāta gha-om. If the nāgas do not rain when it is recited in this way, then their heads will split like an arjaka fruit.

analyzed: aa rdza ka zhes pa dbyug pa dkar po can ma lli ka nag po 'dra ba ste /
translated: An arjaka is a white-staffed mallika-like black one.

original: de'i dog pa ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od kyi 'gas pa de bzhin du zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dog pa ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od kyi 'gas pa de bzhin du zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Just as its fruit is split by the sun's rays, so it is said.

original: char pa 'bebs su 'jug pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: char pa 'bebs su 'jug pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual for making it rain.

original: sngags 'di'i sngon du bzlas pa 'bum phrag gcig ste /
analyzed: sngags 'di'i sngon du bzlas pa 'bum phrag gcig ste /
translated: One hundred thousand repetitions of this mantra beforehand.

original: bye ba bzlas pas sngags 'grub cing /
analyzed: bye ba bzlas pas sngags 'grub cing /
translated: By reciting ten million times, the mantra is accomplished.

original: gang gi tshe sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcu byas na de'i tshe sgrub pa pos gtor ma byin pa tsam gyis klu rnams char 'bebs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcu byas na de'i tshe sgrub pa pos gtor ma byin pa tsam gyis klu rnams char 'bebs te /
translated: When one performs one hundred thousand fire sacrifices, at that time the practitioner, merely by offering a bali, causes the nāgas to rain.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga med do //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga med do //
translated: There is no maṇḍala rite for this.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi chog la sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum phrag gcig dang / sbyin sreg khri phrag gcig byas te de'i tshe klu rnams char 'bebs kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes rtsa ba'i rgyud du nges pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi chog la sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum phrag gcig dang / sbyin sreg khri phrag gcig byas te de'i tshe klu rnams char 'bebs kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes rtsa ba'i rgyud du nges pa'o //
translated: In the maṇḍala rite, having performed one hundred thousand prior approximations and ten thousand fire sacrifices, at that time the nāgas rain, but not otherwise. This is ascertained in the root tantra.

original: da ni sprin dral ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sprin dral ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the dispersal of clouds should be stated.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe char ches par gyur na de'i tshe mtha' yas de dur khrod kyi thal bas kham phor bkang bar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe char ches par gyur na de'i tshe mtha' yas de dur khrod kyi thal bas kham phor bkang bar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Here, when it rains too much, at that time one should place a skull filled with charnel ground ash.

original: sngags pas dur khrod kyi ras la nye bar 'dug nas sngags 'di bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags pas dur khrod kyi ras la nye bar 'dug nas sngags 'di bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The mantrin, sitting on charnel ground cloth, should recite this mantra.

original: aom a'a r+y'a sha ma sh'a na pri y'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat ces pas dral bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a r+y'a sha ma sh'a na pri y'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat ces pas dral bar bya'o //
translated: One should break it with Om, to the Noble One, the beloved of the night, hum hum hum phat phat phat.

original: 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du bsnyen pa dang sbyin sreg bzlas pa'o zhes pa sprin dral ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du bsnyen pa dang sbyin sreg bzlas pa'o zhes pa sprin dral ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: Here also, as before, there is the recitation, the burnt offering, and the mantra recitation. This is the rite for breaking up the clouds.

original: da ni rdo rje gri gug gi sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /🔽'dir gdul dka'i sems can rnams @32a * //
analyzed: da ni rdo rje gri gug gi sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste / 'dir gdul dka'i sems can rnams @32a * //
translated: Now, I will explain the means of achieving the Vajra-Kīla.

original: gdul ba'i don du rdo rje gri gug gi sngags bye ba bzlas pas bsgrub par bya zhing sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcu yis kyang ngo //
analyzed: gdul ba'i don du rdo rje gri gug gi sngags bye ba bzlas pas bsgrub par bya zhing sbyin sreg 'bum phrag bcu yis kyang ngo //
translated: Here, for the sake of taming the difficult beings, one should practice the mantra of Vajra-Kīla ten million times, and also with one hundred thousand burnt offerings.

original: de nas thod lo kor gyi sgrub pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas thod lo kor gyi sgrub pa bya ste /
translated: Then, one should perform the practice of the skull-cup.

original: thod lo kor bdud rtsi lnga dang lhan cig btags la ku th'a ra tshi nna dang bcas pa'i ril bu mig 'bras kyi tshad tsam bya'o //
analyzed: thod lo kor bdud rtsi lnga dang lhan cig btags la ku th'a ra tshi nna dang bcas pa'i ril bu mig 'bras kyi tshad tsam bya'o //
translated: One should mix the skull-cup with the five nectars, and make pills the size of a pea, along with the juice of the kuṭhāra.

original: de nas he ru ka'i khang par song ste /
analyzed: de nas he ru ka'i khang par song ste /
translated: Then, one should go to the temple of Heruka.

original: he ru ka'i zhal du bcu gnas sngags 'di ji srid du sku gzugs kyi zhal gyis ril bu de sgrub pa po la gtod pa'i bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: he ru ka'i zhal du bcu gnas sngags 'di ji srid du sku gzugs kyi zhal gyis ril bu de sgrub pa po la gtod pa'i bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this mantra in the mouth of Heruka as long as the pill is transferred to the practitioner by the mouth of the deity.

original: aom badzra karta ri he badzr'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra karta ri he badzr'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-kartari hevajra-āya hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: dngos grub kyi don du 'bum bzlas pa bya ste stan gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi don du 'bum bzlas pa bya ste stan gcig pa'o //
translated: For the sake of siddhi, one should recite one hundred thousand times in one sitting.

original: de nas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it will be accomplished.

original: de bsgrubs nas ril bu'i mgrin pa la de'i ri mo bya'o //
analyzed: de bsgrubs nas ril bu'i mgrin pa la de'i ri mo bya'o //
translated: Having accomplished that, one should draw the mark of that [vajra] on the neck of the pill.

original: ri mo rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa'i mgrin pa la mthong na gal te ril bu'i mgrin pa de bcad pa de'i tshe dgra rnams mgo bo med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri mo rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa'i mgrin pa la mthong na gal te ril bu'i mgrin pa de bcad pa de'i tshe dgra rnams mgo bo med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees the mark on the neck of the king together with his retinue, then when the neck of that pill is cut, at that time the enemies will become headless.

original: rdo rje gri gug rdzogs so //
analyzed: rdo rje gri gug rdzogs so //
translated: The vajra knife is complete.

original: da ni rdo rje dgra sta'i sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje dgra sta'i sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the sādhana of the vajra enemy.

original: 'dir mu stegs pa'i lha rnams 'gas par 'dod pas rdo rje dgra sta'i thig le bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mu stegs pa'i lha rnams 'gas par 'dod pas rdo rje dgra sta'i thig le bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Here, desiring to destroy the non-Buddhist gods, one should accomplish the bindu of the vajra enemy.

original: 'dir yang sngags bsgrub pa snga ma bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngags bsgrub pa snga ma bzhin du bya ste /
translated: Here, too, one should accomplish the mantra as before.

original: de nas rgyu skar rgyal gyis nya ba la /
analyzed: de nas rgyu skar rgyal gyis nya ba la /
translated: Then, under the constellation Puṣya, the fisherman

original: tshangs pa'i shing gi sa bon blangs te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i shing gi sa bon blangs te /
translated: should take the seed of the tree of Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa'i shing ni pa la shar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i shing ni pa la shar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The tree of Brahmā should be said to be the palāśa tree.

original: de'i sa bon ku th'a ra tshi nna dang bsres la cha mnyam pa mi bskyod pas btags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ku th'a ra tshi nna dang bsres la cha mnyam pa mi bskyod pas btags par bya'o //
translated: Its seed should be mixed with kuṭhāra and equal parts should be bound with akṣobhya.

original: btags nas dgra star bya zhing bskam par bya'o //
analyzed: btags nas dgra star bya zhing bskam par bya'o //
translated: Having bound it, one should make a pestle and dry it.

original: nyi ma gzas bzung ba na rkang pas mnan te sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gzas bzung ba na rkang pas mnan te sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When the sun is eclipsed, one should press it with one’s foot and recite the mantra.

original: aom badzra ku th'a ra p'a ta ya p'a ta ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra ku th'a ra p'a ta ya p'a ta ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra kuṭhāra pātaya pātaya hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: 'di bye ba bzlas nas snga ma bzhin du nyi ma bzung ba na nyin mtshan du bsgrubs nas de bdar bas dgra sta'i rnam pa'i thig le bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bye ba bzlas nas snga ma bzhin du nyi ma bzung ba na nyin mtshan du bsgrubs nas de bdar bas dgra sta'i rnam pa'i thig le bya'o //
translated: Having recited this ten million times, as before, when the sun is eclipsed, one should practice day and night. Having ground it, one should make a drop in the form of a pestle.

original: byas pa des lha gang la sgrub pa pos phyag 'tshal ba des 'gas par byed pa'o zhes pa lha dgas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: byas pa des lha gang la sgrub pa pos phyag 'tshal ba des 'gas par byed pa'o zhes pa lha dgas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the bursting deity.

original: da ni tsha ba'i rims kyi sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tsha ba'i rims kyi sgrub thabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the means of achieving the hot fever.

original: snga ma bzhin du sngags bsgrubs la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sngags bsgrubs la /
translated: Having accomplished the mantra as before,

original: de nas tsha ba'i rims byed par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de nas tsha ba'i rims byed par 'dod pas /
translated: then, desiring to cause the hot fever,

original: dug dang / ske tshe dang / tsi tra ka'i khu bas aa rka'i 'dab ma la dgra bo'i ming bris shing de nas sa gzhi la sor brgyad du brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug dang / ske tshe dang / tsi tra ka'i khu bas aa rka'i 'dab ma la dgra bo'i ming bris shing de nas sa gzhi la sor brgyad du brko bar bya'o //
translated: one should write the name of the enemy on a leaf of the arka plant with poison, black mustard, and citraka juice, and then dig an eight-finger-width hole in the ground.

original: steng du phub ma'i me gzhag ste khri bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: steng du phub ma'i me gzhag ste khri bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Place a fire of chaff above it and recite ten thousand times.

original: aom he badzra dzva ra dzva ra sha tr'um bhr'um h'um h'um h'um @32b phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom he badzra dzva ra dzva ra sha tr'um bhr'um h'um h'um h'um @32b phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hevajra jvara jvara śatruṃ bhrūṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: de nas bsgrub bya rims kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bsgrub bya rims kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the victim will be struck by fever.

original: 'dab ma phyung nas pa'i'o mas bkrus na grol ba'o zhes pa tsha ba'i rims kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma phyung nas pa'i'o mas bkrus na grol ba'o zhes pa tsha ba'i rims kyi cho ga'o //
translated: If the leaf is removed and washed with cow's milk, [the victim] will be freed. This is the rite of the hot fever.

original: da ni chang sgyug pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni chang sgyug pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the rite of vomiting beer should be stated.

original: snga ma bzhin du chang skyug pa'i sngags bsgrubs nas /🔽de nas chang skyug par 'dod pas bsgrub bya'i lte bar yam yig yongs su gyur pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom zhing /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du chang skyug pa'i sngags bsgrubs nas / de nas chang skyug par 'dod pas bsgrub bya'i lte bar yam yig yongs su gyur pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom zhing /
translated: Having accomplished the mantra of vomiting beer as before,🔽then one who desires to vomit beer should meditate on the navel of the one to be affected as a yaṃ syllable, which is transformed into a wind maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du mam yig yongs su gyur pa'i chang gi lto ba can skra grol ba chang skyug pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du mam yig yongs su gyur pa'i chang gi lto ba can skra grol ba chang skyug pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: On top of that, one should meditate on a beer belly transformed from a maṃ syllable, with loose hair, vomiting beer.

original: bsgrub bya chang skyug go //
analyzed: bsgrub bya chang skyug go //
translated: The one to be affected vomits beer.

original: aom he badzra ma r+ya mung+gi r'a ya mam h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags brgyad lhag pa'i brgya bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: aom he badzra ma r+ya mung+gi r'a ya mam h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags brgyad lhag pa'i brgya bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra “Oṃ hevajra māraya muṇḍirāya mam huṃ huṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā” one hundred and eight times.

original: chang skyug pa'i sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: chang skyug pa'i sgrub thabs so //
translated: This is the sādhana of vomiting beer.

original: da ni dbang du bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dbang du bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the rite of enthralling should be stated.

original: snga ma lta bu'i ku ru ku lle'i sngags sngar bshad pa'i bye ba la sogs pa bzlas pa'i cho gas bsgrubs la /
analyzed: snga ma lta bu'i ku ru ku lle'i sngags sngar bshad pa'i bye ba la sogs pa bzlas pa'i cho gas bsgrubs la /
translated: Having accomplished the mantra of Kurukullā as before by the rite of reciting ten million times, and so on, as previously explained,

original: de nas rab tu myos ma dbang du bya bar 'dod pas mya ngan med pa'i brgyad pa la mya ngan med pa'i 'og tu song ste gos dmar po gyon nas myos byed kyi 'bras bu za zhing /
analyzed: de nas rab tu myos ma dbang du bya bar 'dod pas mya ngan med pa'i brgyad pa la mya ngan med pa'i 'og tu song ste gos dmar po gyon nas myos byed kyi 'bras bu za zhing /
translated: Then, one who desires to enthrall a woman should go under the aśoka tree on the eighth day of the month, put on red garments, eat the fruit of the madhuka tree, and make a drop with the juice of the kāmacī flower.

original: k'a ma tsi k'a'i khu bas thig le byas la sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: k'a ma tsi k'a'i khu bas thig le byas la sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra.

original: aom ku ru ku lle hr'i: aa mu k'am me ba sh'i bha wa tu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ku ru ku lle hr'i: aa mu k'am me ba sh'i bha wa tu sv'a h'a /
translated: “Oṃ kuru ku llā hriḥ! Make so-and-so be in love with me, svāhā!”

original: khri bzlas pas 'ong ngo zhes pa dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khri bzlas pas 'ong ngo zhes pa dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: By reciting it ten thousand times, she will come. This is the enthrallment.

original: da ni zla ba dang nyi ma 'dzin pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni zla ba dang nyi ma 'dzin pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the holding of the sun and moon.

original: sngon du bye ba phrag bdun bzlas te sngags pas sngags bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du bye ba phrag bdun bzlas te sngags pas sngags bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having previously recited ten million times, the mantra practitioner should accomplish the mantra.

original: de nas zla ba dang nyi ma 'dzin par 'dod pas s'a lu btags pa las byung ba'i zla ba'am nyi ma byas nas rlangs pas btsos te /
analyzed: de nas zla ba dang nyi ma 'dzin par 'dod pas s'a lu btags pa las byung ba'i zla ba'am nyi ma byas nas rlangs pas btsos te /
translated: Then, one who desires to hold the sun and moon should make a sun or moon from rice flour, and cook it with steam.

original: kham phor sor bzhi par rdo rje'i chu la gzhug cing sngags bzlas so //
analyzed: kham phor sor bzhi par rdo rje'i chu la gzhug cing sngags bzlas so //
translated: Placing it in a four-finger-width bowl with vajra water, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom badzr'a rka na m'a tsa la m'a tsa la tishtha tishtha he badzr'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzr'a rka na m'a tsa la m'a tsa la tishtha tishtha he badzr'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra-arcismati āca la āca la tiṣṭha tiṣṭha he vajrāya hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: nyi ma rnam par 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: nyi ma rnam par 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: For the sun, hold the moon.

original: zla ba rnam par 'dzin pa la ni /
analyzed: zla ba rnam par 'dzin pa la ni /
translated: For the moon, hold the sun.

original: aom badzra tsandra zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: aom badzra tsandra zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Oṃ vajra-candra, etc.

original: khri bzlas na zla ba'am nyi ma gnas so //
analyzed: khri bzlas na zla ba'am nyi ma gnas so //
translated: If one recites ten thousand times, the moon or sun will remain.

original: gci ba las bton na grol ba'o //
analyzed: gci ba las bton na grol ba'o //
translated: If one extracts it from urine, one will be freed.

original: de ltar zla ba dang nyi ma rnam par 'dzin pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba dang nyi ma rnam par 'dzin pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Thus is the procedure for holding the moon and sun.

original: da ni rdo rje skar rtsis la pra dbab pa la 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje skar rtsis la pra dbab pa la 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the entry into the vajra astrology and divination.

original: snga ma bzhin du sngags 'bum phrag bcu bzlas pa dang pad+ma dmar po rnams kyi sbyin sreg 'bum gyis sngags bsgrubs nas so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sngags 'bum phrag bcu bzlas pa dang pad+ma dmar po rnams kyi sbyin sreg 'bum gyis sngags bsgrubs nas so //
translated: As before, having accomplished the mantra by reciting it ten times a hundred thousand times and by the burnt offering of a hundred thousand red lotuses,🔽one should recite the mantra Oṃ nāgarāga kumārikā divyalocayi svāhā at an untimely time.

original: de la sngags ni aom na gr'a na gr'a ku m'a ri ke di bya lo tsa ni sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags 'dis dus ma yin pa'i dus su @33a * //
analyzed: de la sngags ni aom na gr'a na gr'a ku m'a ri ke di bya lo tsa ni sv'a h'a zhes pa'i sngags 'dis dus ma yin pa'i dus su @33a * //
translated: One should recite the mantra Oṃ nāgarāga kumārikā divyalocayi svāhā at an untimely time.

original: gzhon nu ma'i mig dag la brgyad lhag pa'i brgya mngon par bsngags te /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i mig dag la brgyad lhag pa'i brgya mngon par bsngags te /
translated: Having enchanted the eyes of the young woman one hundred and eight times,

original: me tog dang bdug spos la sogs pa nye bar spyod pa lnga yis mchod nas snyan gsan dbab pa'o //
analyzed: me tog dang bdug spos la sogs pa nye bar spyod pa lnga yis mchod nas snyan gsan dbab pa'o //
translated: one should worship with the five offerings of flowers, incense, and so forth, and summon her.

original: bcu bzhi pa'am brgyad pa la snga dro'i dus su bum pa bzhag nas de'i steng du /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa'am brgyad pa la snga dro'i dus su bum pa bzhag nas de'i steng du /
translated: On the fourteenth or eighth day, in the morning, having placed the pot,

original: 'o ma can gyi shing gi yal ga bkod cing 'bru mar zangs ma'i snod du gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'o ma can gyi shing gi yal ga bkod cing 'bru mar zangs ma'i snod du gzhag ste /
translated: one should arrange a branch of a tree that exudes milky sap above it, and place sesame oil in a copper vessel.

original: rgya skyegs kyi khu ba snod gzhan du'o //
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi khu ba snod gzhan du'o //
translated: The lac liquid should be in another vessel.

original: sngags snga mas brgyad lhag pa'i brgya mngon par bsngags te /
analyzed: sngags snga mas brgyad lhag pa'i brgya mngon par bsngags te /
translated: Having enchanted the lac one hundred and eight times with the former mantra,

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong rgya skyegs kyis bskus la til gyi til mar gyis bsku'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong rgya skyegs kyis bskus la til gyi til mar gyis bsku'o //
translated: one should smear the thumb of the left hand with the lac and smear it with sesame oil.

original: de nas gzhon nu ma la bstan la sngags pas sngags zlos shing gzhan la 'dri bar byas te nga'i rdzas sus khyer smros shig / dgongs pa gzhan yang ci 'dra mthong zhes so //
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu ma la bstan la sngags pas sngags zlos shing gzhan la 'dri bar byas te nga'i rdzas sus khyer smros shig / dgongs pa gzhan yang ci 'dra mthong zhes so //
translated: Then, having shown it to the young woman, the mantrin should recite the mantra and ask another, “Speak! Who has taken my property?” “Tell me what else you have seen.”

original: der des mthe bong mthong ste che ge mos rdzas khyer ro //
analyzed: der des mthe bong mthong ste che ge mos rdzas khyer ro //
translated: There, he sees the thumb and says, “So-and-so has taken the substance.

original: dgos pa che ge mor 'gyur ro zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: dgos pa che ge mor 'gyur ro zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: It will be used for such-and-such a purpose.”

original: rdo rje skar rtsis kyi ched du pra dbab pa la 'jug pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skar rtsis kyi ched du pra dbab pa la 'jug pa'i cho ga'o //

analyzed: ngo bo des 'dzin par byed pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa thams cad khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral bas /

analyzed: de bzhin du dri med //

analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa med do //

analyzed: de bzhin du ro med /

analyzed: myong ba po med /

analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa med do //

analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya med /

analyzed: reg pa po med /

analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa med do //

analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi khams med //

analyzed: 'dzin pa po med /

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa med do //

analyzed: de ltar mig la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de ltar khams bco brgyad dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid rin po che rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya ste /

analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gog pas so //

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /

analyzed: 'gyur ba'i ma rig 'gog pa yis // 'du byed nges par 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: 'di byed nges par 'gog pa yis // rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gog pa yis // ming dang gzugs ni 'gog par byed //
translated: By stopping consciousness,🔽Name and form are stopped.

original: ming dang gzugs ni 'gog pa yis //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni 'gog pa yis //
translated: By stopping name and form,

original: skye mched drug rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug rnams 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: skye mched drug rnams 'gog pa yis // reg pa yang ni 'gog par byed //

analyzed: reg pa 'gog pa yis kyang ni // tshor ba nges par 'gog par byed //

original: tshor ba nges par 'gog pa yis //
analyzed: tshor ba nges par 'gog pa yis //

original: sred pa yang ni 'gog par byed //
analyzed: sred pa yang ni 'gog par byed //

analyzed: sred pa nges par 'gog pa yis // nye bar len pa 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gog pa yis // srid pa yang ni 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: srid pa yang ni 'gog pa yis // skye ba nges par 'gog pa'o //

original: rga shi nges par 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rga shi nges par 'gog pa'o //

original: phung po khams rnams nges 'gog pas ;
analyzed: phung po khams rnams nges 'gog pas ;

original: / de nyid nye bar zhi bar bshad //
analyzed: / de nyid nye bar zhi bar bshad //

original: de ltar lus ni 'gog pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar lus ni 'gog pa yis //

original: srog rlung yang ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: srog rlung yang ni 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: srog rlung nges par 'gog pa yis // byang chub sems ni 'gog pa'o //

original: byang chub sems ni 'gog pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni 'gog pa yis //
translated: Through the cessation of bodhicitta,

original: 'dzag pa nges par 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzag pa nges par 'gog pa'o //

original: 'dzag pa'i skad cig 'gog pa yis //
analyzed: 'dzag pa'i skad cig 'gog pa yis //

original: rnal 'byor pa kun sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa kun sangs rgyas nyid //

analyzed: de bzhin nyon mongs rnams 'gog pa // las rnams kyang ni 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: las rnams kyang ni 'gog pa yis // sdug bsngal rnams kyang 'gog pa'o //

original: de rnams skye ba med par ni //
analyzed: de rnams skye ba med par ni //

analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams kyang 'byung ma yin //

analyzed: sdug med bde ldan rnal 'byor pa //

analyzed: rtag tu sems can don rnams byed //

analyzed: de las kyang ni las skye'o //

analyzed: bde ba med na de las slar //

analyzed: dge ba bcu ni yongs spangs las //

analyzed: bde ba gang las 'byung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: bde med sdug bsngal sems las ni //

analyzed: brtags pas byis pa rnal 'byor pa // bsod nams med par ye shes tshogs //

analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du the tshom med //

analyzed: rdul med rdul bral dri ma med //

analyzed: nyes pa spangs pa skyon med pa //

analyzed: shin tu sad pa rnam sad bdag / kun mkhyen kun rig dam pa po //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gog pa las //

analyzed: kun nas thos ldan 'jig rten du //

analyzed: thams cad khyab par byas te bzhugs //

analyzed: zhes pa rtsa ba'i rgyud du de kho na nyid kyi nges pa'o //

analyzed: skyed byed ma dang sring mo dang // bu mo sring mo'i bu mo ni // shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //

analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu mchod //

analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes pa gzung ba dang / @41b 'dzin pa'i sems dag gcig pa nyid //

analyzed: brkyang ma dang ro ma dag gcig pa nyid dang / gtum mo dang khu ba dag gcig pa nyid do //

analyzed: de las nges par sgrub pa'i dbang phyug dang ldan pa ste /
translated: From that, he is endowed with the power of accomplishment.

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: He should worship with the union of wisdom and means, the bliss of unchanging celibacy.

analyzed: phyi rol du ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa'o //

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

analyzed: gar ma chos ma g-yung mo dang // gtum mo de bzhin bram ze mo //

original: rnal 'byor rig pas zhes sngar bshad pa'i chogs dang / shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas zhes sngar bshad pa'i chogs dang / shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //
translated: are to be worshipped by the yogi who knows reality, by the rite of wisdom and means, as before.

original: de nyid rig pas rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas rtag tu mchod //
translated: One should always worship her with the knowledge of reality.

original: dus thams cad du mi 'pho ba'i bde bas cho ga bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du mi 'pho ba'i bde bas cho ga bsten par bya ste /
translated: One should rely on the rite with unchanging bliss at all times.

original: ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar /
analyzed: ji ltar bye bar mi 'gyur bar /
translated: How should one not emit?

original: bye ba ni nges pa'i don gyi khu ba 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: bye ba ni nges pa'i don gyi khu ba 'pho ba'o //
translated: Emitting means the emission of the definitive meaning semen.

original: drang ba'i don gyi phyi rol du skye bos smod pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi phyi rol du skye bos smod pa'o //
translated: The interpretable meaning is the outer emission that is censured by people.

analyzed: de'i phyir ma la sogs pa rnams rnal 'byor bas 'bad pas bsten par bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān’s definitive meaning is that the yogin should rely on his mother and so forth with effort.

original: gang gi tshe gsal por bsten par byas na de'i tshe rgyal po'i rigs la sogs pa rnams kyis byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sdug bsngal ster bar byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gsal por bsten par byas na de'i tshe rgyal po'i rigs la sogs pa rnams kyis byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sdug bsngal ster bar byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: When one relies on them clearly, then the kings and so forth will inflict suffering on the childish yogins.

original: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya rnams zhes pa //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya rnams zhes pa //
translated: The mudrās of the five families

original: thar pa'i rgyur ni brjod par bya //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyur ni brjod par bya // zhes pa ste /
translated: are said to be the cause of liberation.

original: 'dir thar pa'i rgyur phyag rgya zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'dir thar pa'i rgyur phyag rgya zhes bya ba /
translated: Here, the mudrā called the cause of liberation

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs can yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs can yin la /
translated: is one who belongs to the family of the five tathāgatas.

original: rdo rjes te /
analyzed: rdo rjes te /
translated: She is a vajra woman.

original: byang chub sems 'dis rgyas gdab bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems 'dis rgyas gdab bya //
translated: This is the seal of the Awakening Mind.

original: zhes pa phyag rgya ste aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa phyag rgya ste aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
translated: This is the seal of the avadhūtī.

original: 'dir rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams 'khrags 'khrugs su gsungs mod /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams 'khrags 'khrugs su gsungs mod /
translated: Here, the vajra and so forth are the seals of the mother and so forth, which are taught in a mixed up order.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: They should be taken in the proper order.

original: 'dir ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / bram ze mo dang / spyan ma ste lte ba'i pad+ma la'o //🔽sring mo ni m'a ma k'i dang snying gar dang rdo rje'i rigs can ma dang g-yung mo'o //

translated: Here, the mother is the Tathāgata family, the brahmin woman, and Locanā, in the navel lotus.🔽The sister is Māmakī, at the heart, the vajra family, and the weaver woman.

analyzed: bu mo ni me'i khams dang / pad+ma'i rigs can ma dang / gar ma ste mgrin par ro //
translated: The daughter is the fire element, the lotus family, and the dancer, at the throat.

original: sring mo'i bu mo ni rlung gi khams dang / las kyi rigs can ma dang tshos ma ste dpral bar ro //
analyzed: sring mo'i bu mo ni rlung gi khams dang / las kyi rigs can ma dang tshos ma ste dpral bar ro //
translated: The sister’s daughter is the wind element, the action family, and the dyer woman, at the forehead.

original: chung ma ni rdo rje'i dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang / nam mkha'i khams dang gtum mo dang / rin po che'i rigs can ma ste /
analyzed: chung ma ni rdo rje'i dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang / nam mkha'i khams dang gtum mo dang / rin po che'i rigs can ma ste /
translated: The wife is the Vajra Element Queen, the space element, Caṇḍālī, and the jewel family, at the crown.

original: gtsug tor du'o //🔽mthar skyes ma ni ye shes kyi khams dang rdo rje sems @42a * //
analyzed: gtsug tor du'o // mthar skyes ma ni ye shes kyi khams dang rdo rje sems @42a * //
translated: In the crown.

original: dpa'i rigs can ma ste gsang ba'i pad+mar ro //
analyzed: dpa'i rigs can ma ste gsang ba'i pad+mar ro //
translated: The one born at the end is of the nature of the element of gnosis and the family of Vajrasattva, in the secret lotus.

original: de ltar lte ba las steng du phyag rgya'i rigs lnga po 'di /
analyzed: de ltar lte ba las steng du phyag rgya'i rigs lnga po 'di /
translated: Thus, above the navel, these five families of consorts

original: mdor bsdus pa ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni brjod par bya //
translated: are to be expressed in brief.

original: rigs ni rnam pa drug rnams brjod //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa drug rnams brjod //
translated: The families are said to be of six kinds.

original: ces pa gtsug tor du nam mkha'i khams kyi rigs dang / dpral bar rlung gi khams kyi rigs dang / mgrin par me'i khams kyi rigs dang / snying gar chu'i khams kyi rigs dang / lte bar sa'i khams kyi rigs dang / gsang bar ye shes kyi khams kyi rigs so //
analyzed: ces pa gtsug tor du nam mkha'i khams kyi rigs dang / dpral bar rlung gi khams kyi rigs dang / mgrin par me'i khams kyi rigs dang / snying gar chu'i khams kyi rigs dang / lte bar sa'i khams kyi rigs dang / gsang bar ye shes kyi khams kyi rigs so //
translated: Thus, in the crown, the family of the element of space; in the forehead, the family of the element of wind; in the throat, the family of the element of fire; in the heart, the family of the element of water; in the navel, the family of the element of earth; and in the secret place, the family of the element of gnosis.

original: de ltar nam mkha'i gtso bo'i yon tan ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha'i gtso bo'i yon tan ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: Thus, the quality of space is the element of phenomena.

original: rlung gi yon tan gtso bo ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi yon tan gtso bo ni reg bya'o //
translated: The quality of wind is touch.

original: me'i yon tan gtso bo ni ro'o //
analyzed: me'i yon tan gtso bo ni ro'o //
translated: The quality of fire is taste.

original: chu'i yon tan gtso bo ni gzugs so //
analyzed: chu'i yon tan gtso bo ni gzugs so //
translated: The quality of water is form.

original: sa'i yon tan gtso bo ni dri'o //
analyzed: sa'i yon tan gtso bo ni dri'o //
translated: The quality of earth is smell.

original: ye shes kyi khams kyi yon tan gtso bo ni sgra'i khams so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khams kyi yon tan gtso bo ni sgra'i khams so //
translated: The principal quality of the element of wisdom is the element of sound.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / mig gi dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang ; de bzhin du bha ga'i dbang po dang / ngag gi dbang po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / mig gi dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang ; de bzhin du bha ga'i dbang po dang / ngag gi dbang po dang /
translated: Similarly, the organ of hearing, the organ of smell, the organ of sight, the organ of taste, the organ of touch, the organ of mind, and likewise the organ of the bhaga, the organ of speech,

original: lag pa'i dbang po dang / rkang pa'i dbang po dang / rkub kyi dbang po dang / mchog gi dbang dang / de ltar phyag rgya rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa'i dbang po dang / rkang pa'i dbang po dang / rkub kyi dbang po dang / mchog gi dbang dang / de ltar phyag rgya rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: the organ of the hands, the organ of the feet, the organ of the anus, the organ of the penis, and the supreme organ—thus, the pure mudrā.

original: bshang ba 'dzag pa dang / gci ba 'dzag pa dang / 'gro ba dang / len pa dang / smra ba dang / khu ba 'dzag pa ste /🔽de ltar rigs sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyi rigs drug go //
analyzed: bshang ba 'dzag pa dang / gci ba 'dzag pa dang / 'gro ba dang / len pa dang / smra ba dang / khu ba 'dzag pa ste / de ltar rigs sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyi rigs drug go //
translated: The dripping of feces, the dripping of urine, going, taking, speaking, and the dripping of semen—🔽thus, the six families of the thirty-six families.

original: de ltar khams sum cu rtsa drug rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams sum cu rtsa drug rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, they should be known as the thirty-six elements.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'du byed drug dang / tshor ba drug dang / 'du shes drug dang / gzugs drug dang / ye shes drug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'du byed drug dang / tshor ba drug dang / 'du shes drug dang / gzugs drug dang / ye shes drug ste /
translated: Likewise, there are six consciousnesses, six compositional factors, six feelings, six discriminations, six forms, and six pristine awarenesses.

original: de ltar phung po dang khams rnams bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang khams rnams bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are seventy-two aggregates and constituents.

original: de rnams kyang nyis 'gyur gyi mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa las lha rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang nyis 'gyur gyi mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa las lha rnams te /
translated: Those are the deities of the binding of the network of the double of the ḍākinīs.

original: dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa drug rnams dang / sum cu rtsa bdun pa he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa drug rnams dang / sum cu rtsa bdun pa he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang bcas pa'o //
translated: There are thirty-six maṇḍalas and the thirty-seventh is Heruka with Vajravārāhī.

original: de'i rigs gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i rigs gsum ste /
translated: There are three families of that:

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo ni bde mchog ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo ni bde mchog ste /
translated: the body, speech, and mind maṇḍalas are Cakrasaṃvara.

original: nyis 'gyur ni 'khor lo drug gi bde mchog go //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur ni 'khor lo drug gi bde mchog go //
translated: The double is the Cakrasaṃvara of the six cakras.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In this Hevajra Tantra, the Bhagavān taught:

original: 'khor lo sdom pa'i tshig gnyis kyis gsal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: 'khor lo sdom pa'i tshig gnyis kyis gsal bar mdzad de /
translated: The words of Cakrasaṃvara are clarified by the two lines:

original: de nas sngags pas nyis 'gyur mchod //
analyzed: de nas sngags pas nyis 'gyur mchod //
translated: Then the yogin should make the double offering

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: and bind the network of the ḍākinīs.

original: zhes gsungs pa las @42b so ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa las @42b so ;
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: /'dab ma dang zhing la sogs pa nyis 'gyur te /🔽gnas bzhi rnams dang nye ba'i gnas bzhi rnams dang / zhing bzhi rnams dang nye ba'i zhing bzhi rnams dang tsha ndo ha bzhi dang / nye ba'i tsha ndo ha bzhi dang / 'du ba bzhi rnams dang / nye ba'i 'du ba bzhi rnams dang /
analyzed: /'dab ma dang zhing la sogs pa nyis 'gyur te / gnas bzhi rnams dang nye ba'i gnas bzhi rnams dang / zhing bzhi rnams dang nye ba'i zhing bzhi rnams dang tsha ndo ha bzhi dang / nye ba'i tsha ndo ha bzhi dang / 'du ba bzhi rnams dang / nye ba'i 'du ba bzhi rnams dang /
translated: The petals, fields, and so on are doubled.🔽The four abodes, the four near abodes, the four fields, the four near fields, the four charnel grounds, the four near charnel grounds,🔽the four parks, the four near parks, the four assemblies, the four near assemblies,

original: 'thung gcod bzhi rnams dang / nye ba'i 'thung gcod bzhi rnams dang / dur khrod bzhi rnams dang / nye ba'i dur khrod bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: 'thung gcod bzhi rnams dang / nye ba'i 'thung gcod bzhi rnams dang / dur khrod bzhi rnams dang / nye ba'i dur khrod bzhi rnams te /
translated: the four streams, the four near streams, the four islands, and the four near islands.

original: de ltar sa bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar sa bcu gnyis rnams so //
translated: Thus there are twelve levels.

original: re re la yang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma bzhi dpa' bo dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: re re la yang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma bzhi dpa' bo dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: On each level are the four heroines and the heroes.

original: de ltar 'khor lo drug la rnal 'byor ma bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo drug la rnal 'byor ma bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad rnams te /
translated: Thus there are forty-eight yoginis on the six wheels.

original: nam mkha'i 'khor lo la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma brgyad rnams dang / rlung gi 'khor lo la ral gri'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / me'i 'khor lo la rin po che'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / chu'i 'khor lo la pad+ma'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'khor lo la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma brgyad rnams dang / rlung gi 'khor lo la ral gri'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / me'i 'khor lo la rin po che'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / chu'i 'khor lo la pad+ma'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang /
translated: On the celestial wheel are the eight vajra dakinis, on the wind wheel are the eight sword dakinis, on the fire wheel are the eight jewel dakinis, on the water wheel are the eight lotus dakinis,

original: sa'i 'khor lo la 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / ye shes kyi 'khor lo la gri gug gi mkha' 'gro ma brgyad do //
analyzed: sa'i 'khor lo la 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / ye shes kyi 'khor lo la gri gug gi mkha' 'gro ma brgyad do //
translated: on the earth wheel are the eight wheel dakinis, and on the gnosis wheel are the eight curved knife dakinis.

original: rdo rje nor bur stong pa'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad de rdo rje rtse gcig pa 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje nor bur stong pa'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad de rdo rje rtse gcig pa 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: In the vajra jewel are the eight space dakinis, all holding single-pronged vajras.

original: gzhan rnams ni dur khrod bcu drug na dga' ba bcu drug las skyes pa mkha' 'gro ma bcu drug rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni dur khrod bcu drug na dga' ba bcu drug las skyes pa mkha' 'gro ma bcu drug rnams te /
translated: The others are the sixteen dakinis born from the sixteen joys in the sixteen charnel grounds.

original: rna ba gnyis la gnyis dag dang / sna'i bu ga na gnyis dang / mig dag na gnyis dang / lce dang 'phyang ma dag na gnyis dang / spyi gtsug gi bu ga dag na gnyis dang / bshang lam gyi sgo na gnyis dang / gci ba'i sgo na gnyis dang /
analyzed: rna ba gnyis la gnyis dag dang / sna'i bu ga na gnyis dang / mig dag na gnyis dang / lce dang 'phyang ma dag na gnyis dang / spyi gtsug gi bu ga dag na gnyis dang / bshang lam gyi sgo na gnyis dang / gci ba'i sgo na gnyis dang /
translated: Two in the two ears, two in the two nostrils, two in the two eyes, two in the tongue and uvula, two in the two openings of the fontanelle, two in the door of the anus, two in the door of the urethra,

original: khu ba 'pho ba'i sgo na gnyis te de ltar rnal 'byor ma bcu drug rnams so //
analyzed: khu ba 'pho ba'i sgo na gnyis te de ltar rnal 'byor ma bcu drug rnams so //
translated: and two in the door of the emission of semen. Thus there are sixteen yoginis.

original: de rnams kyi dbus na gtso bo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba stong pa nyid kyis 'khyud pa bcom ldan 'das kye'i rdo rje phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa ste 'khor lo sdom pa nyis 'gyur las so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus na gtso bo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba stong pa nyid kyis 'khyud pa bcom ldan 'das kye'i rdo rje phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa ste 'khor lo sdom pa nyis 'gyur las so //
translated: In their midst is the Bhagavān, Hevajra, with twenty-four arms, embracing the emptiness of innate joy, the principal one. He is twice Cakrasaṃvara.

original: dus kyi khyad par gyis bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par gyis bzhugs pa ste /
translated: He abides in the special time.

original: lo rnam par dag pa sku sngon po'o //
analyzed: lo rnam par dag pa sku sngon po'o //
translated: The pure year is his blue body.

original: bgrod pa rnam par dag pas dkar po dang dmar po'i zhabs so //
analyzed: bgrod pa rnam par dag pas dkar po dang dmar po'i zhabs so //
translated: The pure path is his red and white feet.

original: dus gsum rnam par dag pas nag po dang / dmar po dang dkar po'i mgrin pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum rnam par dag pas nag po dang / dmar po dang dkar po'i mgrin pa ste /
translated: The pure three times are his black, red, and white neck.

original: mgo can la sogs pa'i zla ba bzhi rnams dus gcig go //
analyzed: mgo can la sogs pa'i zla ba bzhi rnams dus gcig go //
translated: The four seasons, beginning with the head, are simultaneous.

original: chu srin la sogs pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi dus bzhi rnams te /🔽de rnam par dag pas nag po dang / dmar @43a * //
analyzed: chu srin la sogs pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi dus bzhi rnams te / de rnam par dag pas nag po dang / dmar @43a * //
translated: The four seasons, beginning with the crocodile, are the three months of each season.

original: po dang / dkar po dang / ser po'i zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: po dang / dkar po dang / ser po'i zhal bzhi'o //
translated: By their purification, there are four faces, black, red, white, and yellow.

original: de bzhin du mgo can la sogs pa rnams zla ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dus tshigs drug rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mgo can la sogs pa rnams zla ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dus tshigs drug rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the six seasons, beginning with the head, are the two months of each season.

original: de rnam par dag pas phrag pa drug ste /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas phrag pa drug ste /
translated: By their purification, there are six shoulders.

original: sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'i rang bzhin g-yas dang cig shos dag go //
analyzed: sngon po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'i rang bzhin g-yas dang cig shos dag go //
translated: They are blue, red, and white, on the right and left.

original: de bzhin du zla ba bzhi bzhi'i bdag nyid g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i dpung pa bcu gnyis te zla ba bcu gnyis rnams la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba bzhi bzhi'i bdag nyid g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i dpung pa bcu gnyis te zla ba bcu gnyis rnams la'o //
translated: Similarly, the twelve arms, black, red, and white, on the right and left, are the four months of each season, the twelve months.

original: de bzhin du phyogs kyi dbye bas phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs kyi dbye bas phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Similarly, there are twenty-four hands by the division of the directions.

original: so sor ches grangs so so'i dbye bas g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag gi tshigs kyi rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: so sor ches grangs so so'i dbye bas g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag gi tshigs kyi rtsa rnams so //
translated: The individual fingers are the individual divisions, the channels of the joints of the left and right hands.

original: sor mo'i tshigs drug cu lhag pa'i brgya phrag gsum ni lo'i tshes kyi dbye bas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo'i tshigs drug cu lhag pa'i brgya phrag gsum ni lo'i tshes kyi dbye bas so zhes pa'o //
translated: The three hundred joints of the fingers are the divisions of the days of the year.

original: de ltar rigs drug gi bdag nyid can gyi he ru ka dus kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de ltar rigs drug gi bdag nyid can gyi he ru ka dus kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Thus, the Heruka who is the nature of the six clans is the Wheel of Time.

original: de kho na dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should be called the Primordial Buddha.

original: 'di'i zhal brgya yis mgo bo'i phreng ba ni rig byed kyi yan lag brgya yin la tshangs pa'i mgo bo bcad pa rnams kyi rdo rje thod pa can chen po bcom ldan 'das so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhal brgya yis mgo bo'i phreng ba ni rig byed kyi yan lag brgya yin la tshangs pa'i mgo bo bcad pa rnams kyi rdo rje thod pa can chen po bcom ldan 'das so zhes pa'o //
translated: His hundred faces are the hundred branches of the Vedas, and the great skull-bearer, the Blessed One, is the severed heads of Brahma.

original: nyis 'gyur gyi mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa ni rigs drug gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur gyi mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa ni rigs drug gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The binding of the double dakini net is the nature of the six clans.

original: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du ni rigs lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du ni rigs lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: In other tantras, it is the nature of the five clans.

original: de'i phyir / rigs ni rnam pa drug bshad pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rigs ni rnam pa drug bshad pa //
translated: Therefore: The clans are explained as sixfold.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: In brief, it is fivefold.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum nyid 'gyur //
translated: it becomes threefold.

original: zhes pa'o // de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas /
translated: In this way,

original: rigs dang 'byung ba lnga rnams dang // phung po lnga yi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rigs dang 'byung ba lnga rnams dang // phung po lnga yi bdag nyid can //
translated: the five clans, the five elements, and the five aggregates,

original: 'di yis rig byed bgrangs byed pas //
analyzed: 'di yis rig byed bgrangs byed pas //
translated: are enumerated by this,

original: rigs zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
analyzed: rigs zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
translated: and so are called clans.

original: zhes pa rigs drug dang / rigs lnga dang / rigs gsum gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rigs drug dang / rigs lnga dang / rigs gsum gyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the six clans, the five clans, and the three clans.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /🔽dpal ldan de bzhin nyid du gshegs //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste / dpal ldan de bzhin nyid du gshegs //
translated: Now the characteristics of the Tathagata are to be stated:🔽The glorious one has gone to suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid du 'ang byon pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du 'ang byon pa nyid //
translated: and has also come from suchness.

original: shes rab ldan pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa 'di yis ni //
translated: By this one endowed with wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mngon brjod bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mngon brjod bya //
translated: the Tathagata is to be expressed.

original: zhes te / 'dir shes rab stong pa nyid dang ldan pa de stong pa nyid kyi gzugs dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / 'dir shes rab stong pa nyid dang ldan pa de stong pa nyid kyi gzugs dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: Here, the one endowed with wisdom, emptiness, is together with the form of emptiness.

original: de bzhin nyid du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ste /
translated: In suchness,

original: gsang ba'i pad+mar rdo rje nor bu'i mthar thug par mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa la gtsug tor @43b nam mkha'i khams nas dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba'i pad+ma rnams la rlung dang /
analyzed: gsang ba'i pad+mar rdo rje nor bu'i mthar thug par mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa la gtsug tor @43b nam mkha'i khams nas dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba'i pad+ma rnams la rlung dang /
translated: The vajra reaches the end of the jewel in the secret lotus, and the crown protrudes from the space element in the head, the forehead, the throat, the heart, the navel, and the secret lotus.🔽The vajra abides in the bhaga of the vajra queen, which is the nature of wind, earth, water, fire, and wisdom.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams su bzhugs par gyur to zhes pa dpal ldan byang chub kyi sems rdo rje gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams su bzhugs par gyur to zhes pa dpal ldan byang chub kyi sems rdo rje gshegs pa'o //
translated: The glorious vajra bodhicitta has arrived.

original: de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang byon pa nyid //
translated: And likewise, it arrives in the same way.
