original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid ni @45a * //
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid ni @45a * //
translated: Thus, by the division into the conventional and the ultimate, there are the mundane and the supramundane realities.

original: sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / sgro btags pa dang sgro btags pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bcas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / sgro btags pa dang sgro btags pa med pa dang /
translated: With obscurations and without obscurations, with signs and without signs, with concepts and without concepts, with superimpositions and without superimpositions,

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang nga rgyal med pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang nga rgyal med pa ste /
translated: with pride and without pride.

original: sems can rnams dang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog pas mi skye ba 'jug pa yang med pa'o zhes pa rgyud gzhan thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o
analyzed: sems can rnams dang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog pas mi skye ba 'jug pa yang med pa'o zhes pa rgyud gzhan thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa ste mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o
translated: The learned should understand that the cessation of the twelve links of dependent origination by sentient beings and Buddhas is the absence of non-arising, the absence of engagement, the ascertainment of the Bhagavān Buddha in all other continuums.

original: // da ni yang kun rdzob kyi chos kyi lha la sogs pa brjod par bya ste lus la 'byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: // da ni yang kun rdzob kyi chos kyi lha la sogs pa brjod par bya ste lus la 'byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Now, the deities of conventional phenomena will be described, beginning with “arises in the body” and so forth.

original: 'dir gang gi phyir lus 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid la kun rdzob kyi bde ba yang dag par 'byung ba de'i phyir lha zhes bdag gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi phyir lus 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid la kun rdzob kyi bde ba yang dag par 'byung ba de'i phyir lha zhes bdag gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, because the body, which is of the nature of the five elements, is the source of conventional bliss, therefore I should say “god.”

original: sangs rgyas 'di la bha ga mnga' //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'di la bha ga mnga' //
translated: This Buddha has a bhaga,

original: des na bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod //
translated: therefore he is called Bhagavat.

original: bha ga rnam pa drug tu brjod //
analyzed: bha ga rnam pa drug tu brjod //
translated: The bhaga is said to be of six kinds,

original: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
translated: all the qualities of lordship, and so on,🔽lordship, perfection,

original: dbang phyug dang ni phun tshogs dang // ye shes grags pa dpal rnams dang // skal ba bzang po yon tan nyid //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni phun tshogs dang // ye shes grags pa dpal rnams dang // skal ba bzang po yon tan nyid //
translated: knowledge, fame, glory, and good fortune are the qualities

original: bha ga'i sgra yis brjod par bya //
analyzed: bha ga'i sgra yis brjod par bya //
translated: to be expressed by the term bhaga.

original: yan na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
analyzed: yan na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
translated: The demon of affliction, and so on, is above,

original: 'joms phyir bcom ldan zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms phyir bcom ldan zhes pa'o //
translated: therefore he is called Bhagavat, because he conquers.

original: don dam pas so zhes pa thabs kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pas so zhes pa thabs kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The ultimate, thus, is the definition of method.

original: da ni shes rab brjod par bya //
analyzed: da ni shes rab brjod par bya //
translated: Now, wisdom should be expressed.

original: ma zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ma zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: “Mother” and so on.

original: 'dir thabs ni pha ste khu ba'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dir thabs ni pha ste khu ba'i khams so //
translated: Here, method is the father, the element of semen.

original: shes rab ni ma ste rdul gyi khams so ;
analyzed: shes rab ni ma ste rdul gyi khams so ;
translated: Wisdom is the mother, the element of blood.

original: / bskyed pa ni las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dri za'i sems can 'chi ba'i mthar gyur pa skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: / bskyed pa ni las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dri za'i sems can 'chi ba'i mthar gyur pa skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: “Generation” is the consciousness of the ground-of-all belonging to the rebirth period, which is the mental factor of a gandharva being, who is about to die and is influenced by karma.

original: de kho na 'gro ba'i sgras brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na 'gro ba'i sgras brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is what is referred to by the term “world.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān has said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras rnams khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras rnams khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “O sons of the victors, these three worlds are mind only.”

original: 'gro ba ni de kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni de kho na'o //
translated: The world is just that.

original: 'gro ba skyed par byed do zhes pa shes rab ma ru brjod par bya ste rdul gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba skyed par byed do zhes pa shes rab ma ru brjod par bya ste rdul gyi khams so //
translated: “Generation of the world” should be understood to refer to wisdom, which is the element of dust.

original: de bzhin du skal ba can gyi thabs te khu ba'i khams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du skal ba can gyi thabs te khu ba'i khams so //
translated: Similarly, “the one who has the good fortune of the method” is the element of semen.

original: gang phyir rnam dbye ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir rnam dbye ston pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is taught to be the distinction,

original: shes rab de kho na sring mor brjod par bya /
analyzed: shes rab de kho na sring mor brjod par bya /
translated: wisdom is called “sister.”

original: khams kyi rnam 'gyur so so'i ba spu dang pags pa dang sha dang khrag gi'o //
analyzed: khams kyi rnam 'gyur so so'i ba spu dang pags pa dang sha dang khrag gi'o //
translated: The transformation of the elements is the individual [elements] of body hair, skin, flesh, and blood.

original: de bzhin du thabs ni spun zla ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs ni spun zla ste ;
translated: Similarly, “the one who has the good fortune of the method” is the brother.

original: gang gi phyir rtsa dang rus pa dang rkang gi rnam par dbye ba ston pa de'i phyir khu ba'i khams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsa dang rus pa dang rkang gi rnam par dbye ba ston pa de'i phyir khu ba'i khams so //
translated: Since it is the display of the divisions of the channels, bones, and marrow, therefore it is the semen element.

original: yon tan 'jo phyir shes rab de kho na ni bu mor yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'jo phyir shes rab de kho na ni bu mor yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Wisdom is also called the daughter, because it enjoys the qualities.

original: yon tan rnams ni sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / chos kyi yul rnams te /
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / chos kyi yul rnams te /
translated: The qualities are the objects of sound, touch, form, taste, smell, and mental objects.

original: de rnams 'jo ba'i phyir na de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'jo ba'i phyir na de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it enjoys them, it is the apprehender of them.

original: de bzhin du thabs @45b ni bu ste mig la sogs rnams rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir thabs kyi khams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs @45b ni bu ste mig la sogs rnams rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir thabs kyi khams so //
translated: Similarly, the method is the son, because the eyes and so on are engaged.

original: de bzhin du shes rab ni sring mo'i bu mo ste yul la rnam par shes pa rnams rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab ni sring mo'i bu mo ste yul la rnam par shes pa rnams rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, wisdom is the sister's daughter, because the consciousnesses are engaged in the objects.

original: thabs ni spun zla'i bu ste mig la sogs pa rnams la rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o de bzhin du 'pho ba'i bde ba la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab ni chung mar brjod do //
analyzed: thabs ni spun zla'i bu ste mig la sogs pa rnams la rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o de bzhin du 'pho ba'i bde ba la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab ni chung mar brjod do //
translated: Likewise, wisdom is called the wife because of the entry into the bliss of the descent.

original: thabs kyang khyo bo ru brjod de phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyi phyir gnyis ka yang 'pho ba'i bde ba'i chos las so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyang khyo bo ru brjod de phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyi phyir gnyis ka yang 'pho ba'i bde ba'i chos las so zhes pa'o //
translated: The method is also called the husband, because of the mutual dependence of the two, which is the dharma of the bliss of the descent.

original: chags pa dang bral ba las shes rab ni reg min mthar skyes ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba las shes rab ni reg min mthar skyes ma zhes brjod do //
translated: From the separation of passion, wisdom is called the virgin born in the end of the imperceptible.🔽The method is also like that.

original: thabs kyang ngo zhes pa phyag rgya drug gi nges pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyang ngo zhes pa phyag rgya drug gi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the six seals.

original: khams kun rmongs par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khams kun rmongs par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it confuses all the elements,

original: bram ze mo zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: bram ze mo zhes brjod par bya //
translated: it should be called the Brahmin woman.

original: 'tshed byed shes rab tshos ma'o //
analyzed: 'tshed byed shes rab tshos ma'o //
translated: The wisdom of the burning is the cook.

original: khams g-yo byed phyir gar mkhan ma //
analyzed: khams g-yo byed phyir gar mkhan ma //
translated: Because it moves the elements, it is the dancer.

original: sreg byed phyir nag tu ma mor bshad //
analyzed: sreg byed phyir nag tu ma mor bshad //
translated: Because it burns, it is explained as the black woman.

original: reg min phyir na g-yung mor bshad //
analyzed: reg min phyir na g-yung mor bshad //
translated: Because it is not touched, it is explained as the virgin.

original: de bzhin du thabs kyang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs kyang shes par bya ste /
translated: The method should be understood in the same way.

original: bya ba lnga'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: bya ba lnga'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: From the nature of the five actions.

original: de ltar thams cad phyi rol du de'i phyir mu stegs pa rnams kyis rig byed la sogs pa rnams kyis rab tu brtags pa ste //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad phyi rol du de'i phyir mu stegs pa rnams kyis rig byed la sogs pa rnams kyis rab tu brtags pa ste //
translated: Thus, everything is external. Therefore, the tīrthikas imagine with the Vedas, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis bud med thams cad dang skyes pa thams cad mi'i rigs gcig tu yang dag par byung ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bud med thams cad dang skyes pa thams cad mi'i rigs gcig tu yang dag par byung ba ste /
translated: All women and all men are born in the same human class by nature.

original: de rnams la rigs gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes pa rgyud gzhan thams cad du mngon par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rigs gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes pa rgyud gzhan thams cad du mngon par dgongs pa'o //
translated: They do not have another class. This is the intention in all the tantras.

original: da ni khams kyi rang bzhin gyis sngags bzlas pa la sogs pa brjod pa zhes pa la sogs pas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni khams kyi rang bzhin gyis sngags bzlas pa la sogs pa brjod pa zhes pa la sogs pas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the mantra recitation, etc. of the nature of the elements will be explained by “Here, the recitation is said to be the recitation of the vowels and consonants.”

original: 'dir sems can thams cad kyi brjod pa ni a'a li k'a li dbyangs dang gsal byed dag gi brjod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir sems can thams cad kyi brjod pa ni a'a li k'a li dbyangs dang gsal byed dag gi brjod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Here, the recitation of all sentient beings is the recitation of the vowels and consonants.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
analyzed: de'i phyir / brjod pa bzlas pa yin par bshad //
translated: the recitation is said to be the recitation of the vowels and consonants.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: This is for the yogis of reality.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor 'gyur //
analyzed: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor 'gyur //
translated: The footprint is the maṇḍala.

original: rkang pa dag gis sa gzhi nyed pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dag gis sa gzhi nyed pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The ground is called the maṇḍala because it is covered with footprints.

original: de bzhin du /🔽lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgyar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin du / lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgyar 'gyur //
translated: Similarly,🔽The hand gesture is the mudrā.

original: sor mo nyed pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: sor mo nyed pa gang yin pa //
translated: The fingers are the mudrā.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: sems can rnams kyis gang sems pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis gang sems pa //
translated: What is thought by sentient beings

original: de kho na bsam bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na bsam bya ste /
translated: Is just what should be thought.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zhes pa'o //
translated: The yogis and yoginīs know the mind of others.

original: gang phyir bsam bral bsam bya ba //
analyzed: gang phyir bsam bral bsam bya ba //
translated: Because it is beyond thought, it is what should be thought.

original: zhes pa bsam bral zhes pa sems pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa bsam bral zhes pa sems pa med pa ste /
translated: What is beyond thought is without thought.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsam bya gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsam bya gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is what should be thought by the yogis and yoginīs.

original: pha'i yul la 'chi ba'i mthar gyur pa skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems can gyi 'pho ba'i gnas skabs su thob pa'i bde ba gang yin pa'i bde ba de nyid ni lo bcu drug gi mtshams su skyes pas rang gi bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha'i yul la 'chi ba'i mthar gyur pa skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems can gyi 'pho ba'i gnas skabs su thob pa'i bde ba gang yin pa'i bde ba de nyid ni lo bcu drug gi mtshams su skyes pas rang gi bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: The pleasure that is obtained by a man at the time of the transference of a sentient being who is about to die and is about to be born is the pleasure that should be eaten by him at the age of sixteen.

original: bud med kyis ni lo bcu gnyis kyi mtshams su longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bud med kyis ni lo bcu gnyis kyi mtshams su longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: A woman should be enjoyed for twelve years.

original: bde ba gang gis 'chi ba 'dir te /
analyzed: bde ba gang gis 'chi ba 'dir te /
translated: That bliss by which one dies here,

original: 'khor ba pa rnams kyis 'khor bar skye ba dang gnas pa'i bde ba de kho na @46a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa rnams kyis 'khor bar skye ba dang gnas pa'i bde ba de kho na @46a * //
translated: that bliss of birth and abiding in cyclic existence of those in cyclic existence,

original: brtan par gyur pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsam gtan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan par gyur pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsam gtan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: that is called the bliss of the yogins and yoginīs.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i snying po bdag gis 'di thams cad ni mdor bsdus pa'i kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'bum phrag lnga pa las /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i snying po bdag gis 'di thams cad ni mdor bsdus pa'i kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'bum phrag lnga pa las /
translated: O Vajra Queen, I have summarized all of this from the Hevajra Tantra in 500,000 verses.

original: 'bum phrag so so'i nang nas le'u so so las bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ste le'u lnga pa rnams su'o /
analyzed: 'bum phrag so so'i nang nas le'u so so las bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ste le'u lnga pa rnams su'o /
translated: The summarized meaning is taught in each chapter from each of the 100,000 verses.

original: // /'di las phyi ma spyod pa'i le'u la sogs pa ni rgya cher rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: // /'di las phyi ma spyod pa'i le'u la sogs pa ni rgya cher rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The later chapters such as the chapter on conduct should be understood in detail.

original: rigs kyi le'u ru tshigs su bcas pa sum cu rnams kyis 'bum phrag dang po las bsdus pa'i don to /
analyzed: rigs kyi le'u ru tshigs su bcas pa sum cu rnams kyis 'bum phrag dang po las bsdus pa'i don to /
translated: In the chapter on the families, the summarized meaning of the first 100,000 verses is presented in thirty verses.

original: // / sngags kyi le'u ru tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rnams kyis 'bum phrag gnyis pa las so //
analyzed: // / sngags kyi le'u ru tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rnams kyis 'bum phrag gnyis pa las so //
translated: In the Mantra Chapter, in forty verses, from the second hundred thousand.

original: lha'i le'u ru nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis 'bum phrag gsum pa las so //
analyzed: lha'i le'u ru nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis 'bum phrag gsum pa las so //
translated: In the Deity Chapter, in twenty-four verses, from the third hundred thousand.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i le'u ru 'bum phrag bzhi pa las so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i le'u ru 'bum phrag bzhi pa las so //
translated: In the Initiation Chapter, in six verses, from the fourth hundred thousand.

original: tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rnams kyis de kho na nyid kyi le'u 'bum phrag lnga pa las so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rnams kyis de kho na nyid kyi le'u 'bum phrag lnga pa las so //
translated: In the Reality Chapter, in twenty verses, from the fifth hundred thousand.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don le'u lnga rnams su rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rgya cher 'grel pa 'di yis rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don le'u lnga rnams su rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rgya cher 'grel pa 'di yis rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, in this commentary, the meaning of the five chapters, which are summarized in one hundred and twenty verses, should be understood by the yogis.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel pa stong phrag drug par de kho na nyid nges par mdor bstan pa'i mdor bsdus chen po'o /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel pa stong phrag drug par de kho na nyid nges par mdor bstan pa'i mdor bsdus chen po'o /
translated: This is the great summary of the definitive brief explanation of reality in the six thousand commentary on the Hevajra.

original: // / de ltar de kho na nyid kyi le'u rdzogs so //
analyzed: // / de ltar de kho na nyid kyi le'u rdzogs so //
translated: Thus ends the Reality Chapter.

original: dpal kye'i rdo rje bsdus pa'i don gyis 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal kye'i rdo rje bsdus pa'i don gyis 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the condensed glorious Hevajra is complete.

original: // / rje btsun byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying pos mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: // / rje btsun byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying pos mdzad pa'o //
translated: It was composed by the venerable bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajragarbha.🔽It was translated by the Indian abbot Dānaśīla and the translator-monk Ga-wa-bal-wa.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po d'a na sh'i la dang / lo ts'a ba 'bro seng dkar sh'a kya 'od kyis bsgyur ba ;🔽slad kyi rgya gar gyi mkhan po su bh'u ti shr'i sh'a nti dang / lo ts'a ba cog gru ting nge 'dzin bzang pos zhus so //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po d'a na sh'i la dang / lo ts'a ba 'bro seng dkar sh'a kya 'od kyis bsgyur ba ; slad kyi rgya gar gyi mkhan po su bh'u ti shr'i sh'a nti dang / lo ts'a ba cog gru ting nge 'dzin bzang pos zhus so //
translated: Later, the Indian abbot Subhutiśānti and the translator Chokro Lüi Gyaltsen revised it.

original: yang slad kyi rgya gar gyi mkhan po rgyal po'i sras /🔽dpal 'jigs med lha'i zhal sngar lo ts'a ba snyel cor dge slong pra dzny'a k'i rtis yul dbus 'gyur gyi dpes gtan la phab pa /

original: rnal 'byor dbang phyug spyod pa yis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang phyug spyod pa yis //

original: gcig sogs phyi ru rgyu med pas //
analyzed: gcig sogs phyi ru rgyu med pas //

original: bsten cing de nyid thim pa ste //
analyzed: bsten cing de nyid thim pa ste //
translated: one should rely on it, and that dissolves into reality.

original: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog //
translated: The supreme vow of pure conduct,

original: dka' thub mthar phyin dka' thub che //
analyzed: dka' thub mthar phyin dka' thub che //
translated: the perfection of asceticism, the great ascetic.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //

original: gzhan yang rang nyid stong pa nyid dang / snying rje tha mi dad pa la gnas te he ru kar byas la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang nyid stong pa nyid dang / snying rje tha mi dad pa la gnas te he ru kar byas la /
translated: Moreover, abiding in the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, one becomes Heruka.

original: phyi rol gyi skye bo gdul ba'i ched du rdul tshon la sogs pa gang dag kha dog lngar gnas pa de dang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa lnga 'am drug gi yon tan dang ldan par bstan pas kyang gdul bar dka' ba'i skye bo 'dul la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye bo gdul ba'i ched du rdul tshon la sogs pa gang dag kha dog lngar gnas pa de dang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa lnga 'am drug gi yon tan dang ldan par bstan pas kyang gdul bar dka' ba'i skye bo 'dul la /
translated: For the purpose of taming external beings, those colors such as the colored powders and so forth that abide as five colors are explained to possess the qualities of the five or six tathagatas, thereby taming beings who are difficult to tame.

original: mos par 'gyur ba de bas rigs lnga dag dang mnyam par ldan pa bstan par bya ba dang / de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid pas kha dog dkar po //
analyzed: mos par 'gyur ba de bas rigs lnga dag dang mnyam par ldan pa bstan par bya ba dang / de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid pas kha dog dkar po //
translated: Those who are inspired should be taught to possess the qualities of the five families, and likewise, since the nature of the dhatu of phenomena is white,

original: rigs dang tshon thams cad par bsdus te /
analyzed: rigs dang tshon thams cad par bsdus te /

original: bstan par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba yin pas /

analyzed: rigs gcig tu ni rnam par brtag / ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du de ltar bstan pa de dag kyang sngags kyi tshul gyis las kyi dang por @48a * // gtogs pa las gzhan pa /
translated: And likewise, those who are taught in this way, by the method of mantra, are to be kept secret and hidden from those who are beginners in the action,🔽and from those who are engaged in the path of the śrāvakas,

original: nyan thos kyi lam la gnas pa dang / rang rgyal ba'i lam la gnas pa dang / mu stegs byed pa la gsang zhing sba bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam la gnas pa dang / rang rgyal ba'i lam la gnas pa dang / mu stegs byed pa la gsang zhing sba bar bya ba yin te /
translated: those who are engaged in the path of the pratyekabuddhas, and those who are tīrthikas.

original: de bas na kha dog du ma nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: de bas na kha dog du ma nyid kyis ni /
translated: Therefore, by their many colors,

original: gang phyir bye brag mtshon mi bya //
analyzed: gang phyir bye brag mtshon mi bya //
translated: they are not to be distinguished.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzhan yang spyod pa'i mchog byed pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyod pa'i mchog byed pas /

original: sems can rnams kyi don du nang gi ma rungs pa'i sems kyis dpa' bo he ru kar bsgrubs la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du nang gi ma rungs pa'i sems kyis dpa' bo he ru kar bsgrubs la /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings, having accomplished the hero Heruka with an inner unruly mind,

original: kha dog ste rigs lnga'i bdag nyid du gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: kha dog ste rigs lnga'i bdag nyid du gnas par bya ste /
translated: should abide in the color, that is, in the nature of the five families.

original: 'di ltar rgyal rigs dang / rje rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / gdol pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal rigs dang / rje rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / gdol pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, they are the kṣatriya, vaiśya, brahmin, śūdra, caṇḍāla, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi nang du de rnams dang mthun pa'i lus su bsgyur la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du de rnams dang mthun pa'i lus su bsgyur la /
translated: Having transformed into a body consistent with those,

analyzed: spyod pa bstan par bya ba dang / de rnams kyi nang du song ste /
translated: one should teach the conduct, and having gone among them,🔽one should refute each of their castes and establish all castes as a single caste of the vajra caste.

original: rang rang gi rigs rnams sun phyung la rigs thams cad rdo rje'i rigs su rigs gcig par bsgrub par bya ba dang / de bzhin du rje'i rigs kyi nang du rigs bzhi po mtshon par bya ba sbas te /
analyzed: rang rang gi rigs rnams sun phyung la rigs thams cad rdo rje'i rigs su rigs gcig par bsgrub par bya ba dang / de bzhin du rje'i rigs kyi nang du rigs bzhi po mtshon par bya ba sbas te /
translated: Similarly, having hidden the four castes within the royal caste,🔽one should enter in accordance with reality and teach the Dharma to be tamed.🔽Similarly, one should act inconsistently with all castes and teach the Dharma.

original: de nyid dang mthun par zhugs te gdul ba'i chos bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rigs thams cad kyi nang du phan tshun mi rigs par bya zhing chos bstan pa dang / de bzhin du las kyi phyag rgya bsgrub par bya ba'i ched du yang 'jig rten pa'i kha na ma tho ba spang bar bya ba'i rgyus rigs gzhan gyi lus su bsgyur te las kyi phyag rgya bsgrub par nges so //
analyzed: de nyid dang mthun par zhugs te gdul ba'i chos bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rigs thams cad kyi nang du phan tshun mi rigs par bya zhing chos bstan pa dang / de bzhin du las kyi phyag rgya bsgrub par bya ba'i ched du yang 'jig rten pa'i kha na ma tho ba spang bar bya ba'i rgyus rigs gzhan gyi lus su bsgyur te las kyi phyag rgya bsgrub par nges so //
translated: Similarly, in order to accomplish the karmamudra, one should definitely transform into the body of another caste due to the cause of abandoning worldly misdeeds and accomplish the karmamudra.

original: de'i phyir // rigs ni du ma nyid dag gis //
analyzed: de'i phyir // rigs ni du ma nyid dag gis //
translated: because of the many kinds of families,

original: gang phyir bye brag mtshon mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang phyir bye brag mtshon mi bya // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the distinctions are not indicated.

original: 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i don ni rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid na gsal te de bas na de la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i don ni rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid na gsal te de bas na de la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The definitive meaning of these [verses] is clear in the Root Tantra itself, and so one should engage it there.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: And that is stated thus:

original: stong nyid he ru kar sbyor bas //
analyzed: stong nyid he ru kar sbyor bas //
translated: The union with emptiness Heruka

original: sa chu me rlung nam mkha' zhes //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung nam mkha' zhes //
translated: is the earth, water, fire, wind, and space,

original: khu ba rlung gnyis gnas pa la //
analyzed: khu ba rlung gnyis gnas pa la //
translated: the two vital essences and winds abiding

original: mi phyed lam du bcug byas pa //
analyzed: mi phyed lam du bcug byas pa //
translated: in the path of the indivisible

original: dus mtha'i me yis thal bar byed //
analyzed: dus mtha'i me yis thal bar byed //
translated: burned to ashes by the fire at the end of time.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du mtshon du med //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du mtshon du med // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Like space, it is not indicated.

original: gang du stong pa zhes bya ba'i lam la gnas na ye shes kyi gzi brjid mched par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang du stong pa zhes bya ba'i lam la gnas na ye shes kyi gzi brjid mched par 'gyur la /
translated: When abiding in the path called “emptiness,” the splendor of gnosis spreads.

original: gzi brjid des khu ba'i rigs rnam pa lnga dang / rlung gi rigs rnam pa lnga po ro mnyam zhing gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid /
analyzed: gzi brjid des khu ba'i rigs rnam pa lnga dang / rlung gi rigs rnam pa lnga po ro mnyam zhing gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa nyid /
translated: By that splendor, the five kinds of vital essence families and the five kinds of wind families become of equal taste and merge into one.

analyzed: mtshon du med cing tha dad pa'i rang bzhin spangs pa las gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The statement in the Tathāgataguhya that “it is inexpressible and free from a different nature” is the definitive meaning.

analyzed: gzhan du na sems rtse gcig par mi gnas pas khu ba dang gci ba dang bshang ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Otherwise, since the mind does not abide one-pointedly, semen, urine, feces, and so on

analyzed: rigs tha dad @48b par gnas shing bye brag tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to be “abiding in different types and having different distinctions.”

analyzed: da ni sgrub pa po'i gnas kyi khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the special place of the practitioner,

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud 'di nyid las /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud 'di nyid las /
translated: in this very Condensed Tantra,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: it says:

original: shing gcig dang ni dur khrod dang // ma mo'i khyim dang mtshan dus sam //
analyzed: shing gcig dang ni dur khrod dang // ma mo'i khyim dang mtshan dus sam //
translated: “At a solitary tree, a charnel ground, a house of a mātṛkā, at night,

original: yang na dben pa'am bas mtha' ru //
analyzed: yang na dben pa'am bas mtha' ru //
translated: or in a secluded place or a remote place,

original: de ru bsgom pa bzang bar brjod //
analyzed: de ru bsgom pa bzang bar brjod //
translated: meditation is said to be excellent there.”

original: zhes bya ba'i don ni phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis phye la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ni phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis phye la shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood as divided into outer and inner.

original: de yang re zhig phyi'i ni las dang po pa'i sgrub pa po bdag yid nyams dga' zhing skye bo'i 'du 'dzis dben pa'i sa phyogs su bsgrubs na dngos grub kyi mtshan ma 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang re zhig phyi'i ni las dang po pa'i sgrub pa po bdag yid nyams dga' zhing skye bo'i 'du 'dzis dben pa'i sa phyogs su bsgrubs na dngos grub kyi mtshan ma 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, the external [rite] is that the beginner, the adept, should practice in a place that delights the mind, which is free from the commotion of people, and the signs of power will arise.

analyzed: gnas de dag kyang mi ma yin pa gnas pa'i shing gcig skyes pa dang / ma mo'i khyim zhes bya ba gnod sbyin mo dang sha za mo gang na gnas pa dang / dben pa'am bas mtha' ste yang na de las gzhan pa'i mi ma yin pa gang du 'du ba'i gnas mi rgod la sogs pas dben ba'i gnas de ru rnal 'byor pa 'khod la sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed de /
translated: Those places are a tree that is the abode of a non-human, a place called the house of a mother, where a yakṣiṇī or a piśācī dwells, a solitary place or a wilderness, or else, a place where non-humans gather, which is free from thieves and so on. The yogī should live in such a place, and generate great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: de na gnas pa'i mi ma yin pa rnams la gtor ma dus gsum du btang zhing /
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i mi ma yin pa rnams la gtor ma dus gsum du btang zhing /

original: mi ma yin pa de dag la 'di skad ces kho bo 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig byed kyis /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa de dag la 'di skad ces kho bo 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig byed kyis /

analyzed: de dang de khyed kyis bsgrub par rigs so zhes yang dang yang du bsgo ba na /

translated: And by accomplishing that, one will be able to benefit beings.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: The definitive meaning of this place is as stated in the Root Tantra:

original: rang lus ri bo mchog yin te //
analyzed: rang lus ri bo mchog yin te //
translated: One's own body is the supreme mountain,

original: de las skyes pa'i shing chen gang //🔽rtse mos lha rnams smin byed cing //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shing chen gang // rtse mos lha rnams smin byed cing //

analyzed: rtsa bas klu sogs smin par byed // yal ga de yis mi la sogs //
translated: And its roots ripen the nagas and so forth.🔽Its branches fully ripen humans and so forth.

original: yongs su smin byed shing de yin //
analyzed: yongs su smin byed shing de yin //
translated: That is the tree.

original: de ru gnas par rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de ru gnas par rab tu brjod //
translated: It is said to be the place of abiding,

original: gang du dbugs ni mi rgyu ba //
analyzed: gang du dbugs ni mi rgyu ba //
translated: Where the breath does not move.

original: de ni dur khrod ces su bshad //
analyzed: de ni dur khrod ces su bshad //
translated: That is explained as the charnel ground.

original: ma mo'i khyim ni stong pa nyid //
analyzed: ma mo'i khyim ni stong pa nyid //
translated: The empty house of the mother is emptiness.

original: seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya'o //

original: mtshan ma'i spras pas mi brdzi zhing //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i spras pas mi brdzi zhing //
translated: Undaunted by the adornment of signs,

analyzed: rtogs par dka' bas mtshan mo yin //

analyzed: sa bon yi ge phyag mtshan dang // kha dog dbyibs dang rigs mi mnga' //

original: dben pa'am bas mtha' de yin la //
analyzed: dben pa'am bas mtha' de yin la //
translated: It is solitary or in the wilderness.

original: bsgom pa bzang po 'ang de nyid yin //🔽zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa bzang po 'ang de nyid yin // zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: It is also the excellent meditation.

analyzed: spyod par nus pa'i tshad bstan pa'i phyir /🔽cung zad drod ni thob pa na //🔽gal te @49a * //🔽spyod pa byed 'dod pa //🔽'on te 'grub 'gyur 'dod yod na //🔽'dis ni spyod pa spyad pa nyid //🔽ces gsungs te /🔽'di'i don yang rtsa ba'i rgyud nyid la 'jug par bya ste /🔽de yang ji skad du /🔽gal te spyod pa byed 'dod pa //🔽yan lag drug sbyor gang yin de //🔽du ba smig rgyu la sogs pa'i //🔽drod ni dang por bskyed par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the definitive meaning of the tathagatas.

analyzed: 'di'i don ni yang rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don du spyod pa byed par 'dod pa rnams kyis //

analyzed: dang po du ba dang smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyis drod bskyed nas spyod pa la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: First, those yogis who wish to perform the conduct for the sake of sentient beings should generate heat with smoke, mirages, and so forth, and then enter into the conduct.

original: gzhan du na 'jig rten pa'i bzhad gang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'jig rten pa'i bzhad gang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they will become the laughingstock of the world.

original: des skyes bu 'dod chags can rnams gdul bar bya'i ched du /
analyzed: des skyes bu 'dod chags can rnams gdul bar bya'i ched du /
translated: For the sake of subduing those men who are desirous,

analyzed: 'pho ba med pa'i ye shes nyams su blangs la /
translated: one should practice the gnosis of nonemission.🔽Then,🔽one should examine the conduct

original: gdod ; shin tu bzhin bzang mig yangs ma //
analyzed: gdod ; shin tu bzhin bzang mig yangs ma //
translated: with a very beautiful, large-eyed

original: rang gis dbang bskur snying rje can //
analyzed: rang gis dbang bskur snying rje can //
translated: queen who has been consecrated and is compassionate,

original: btsun mo rdo rje'i rigs bzung la //🔽spyod pa bya bar brtag par bya //
analyzed: btsun mo rdo rje'i rigs bzung la // spyod pa bya bar brtag par bya //
translated: who is taken as the queen of the vajra family.

analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi dngos med na /
translated: If there is no one of the vajra family,

analyzed: rang 'dod lha yi rigs kyis bya //
translated: one should do it with a deity of one's own family.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽The meaning of this is as follows:

original: 'di'i don yang gdol pa'i rigs las byung ba'i bu mo skyes bu gzhan gyis reg par bya ba ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i don yang gdol pa'i rigs las byung ba'i bu mo skyes bu gzhan gyis reg par bya ba ma yin pa'am /
translated: One should examine the conduct with a girl born into the caṇḍāla caste who has not been touched by another man,

original: yang na rigs gang yang rung ste gzugs dang lang tshos brgyan pa la byang chub kyi sa bon gyis sbyangs te zhes bya ba rang gi de la mi dad pa med par snyoms par 'jug pa'i las byas la /

translated: Or else, one should practice with any suitable type, adorned with form and youth, having purified with the seed of enlightenment, that is, having performed the act of union without lack of faith in oneself.

original: bde ba'i byang chub kyi sems des de'i sems sbyangs la /
analyzed: bde ba'i byang chub kyi sems des de'i sems sbyangs la /
translated: With that blissful bodhicitta, one should purify one’s mind.🔽One should go everywhere together with that, and one should dance, which arises from the Amoghasiddhi family, and so on, with vajra songs, and so on, in order to tame passionate men.

original: de dang lhan cig kun du 'gro bar bya zhing rdo rje'i glu la sogs pas skyes bu 'dod chags can rnams gdul ba dang / don yod grub pa'i rigs las byung ba'i gar bya ba ste de ni rgyud bsdus pa 'di nyid las ji skad du /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig kun du 'gro bar bya zhing rdo rje'i glu la sogs pas skyes bu 'dod chags can rnams gdul ba dang / don yod grub pa'i rigs las byung ba'i gar bya ba ste de ni rgyud bsdus pa 'di nyid las ji skad du /
translated: In this very Compendium of Practice it says:

original: gal te dga' bas glu blangs te //
analyzed: gal te dga' bas glu blangs te //
translated: If one sings a song of joy,

original: de tshe rdo rje mchog dang ldan //
